meanings.def: in or to what place or situation
examples: Where do you live?
I wonder where they will take us to.
Where (= at what point) did I go wrong in my calculations?
Where (= in what book, newspaper, etc.) did you read that?
Just where (= to what situation or final argument) is all this leading us?
The products include porcelain and ceramic ware.
Don't wear that jacket—it's far too big!
Comfortable and smart, this jacket is suitable for office wear.
Where are you going on your next adventure?
He was free to go where he liked.

meanings.def: used after words or phrases that refer to a place or situation to mean ‘at, in or to which’
examples: It's one of the few countries where people drive on the left.

meanings.def: the place or situation in which
examples: We then moved to Paris, where we lived for six years.

related: Pussy Cat, Pussy Cat, Where Have You Been?

meanings.def: (in) the place or situation in which
examples: This is where I live.
Sit where I can see you.
Where people were concerned, his threshold of boredom was low.
That's where (= the point in the argument at which) you're wrong.
The products include porcelain and ceramic ware.
Don't wear that jacket—it's far too big!
Comfortable and smart, this jacket is suitable for office wear.
Where are you going on your next adventure?
He was free to go where he liked.
